body_html:
@drpngx @zheng-xq While running ./tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_sanity.sh locally, I get

FAIL: buildifier found errors and/or warnings in above BUILD files.
buildifier suggested the following changes:
./tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_sanity.sh: line 285: buildifier: command not found

So, I can't iterate locally to address this.

Moreover, I seem to be getting another set of messages locally that the execution of the sanity check script doesn't seem to produce for you on Jenkins:

FAIL: mismatch in packaged licenses and external dependencies
Please remove the licenses for the following external dependencies:
//third_party/hadoop
@boringssl//
@curl//
@jemalloc//

These don't seem to show up in your CI build.

Please let me know what I can do to make it work.
body:
@drpngx @zheng-xq While running ./tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_sanity.sh locally, I get

> FAIL: buildifier found errors and/or warnings in above BUILD files.
> buildifier suggested the following changes:
> ./tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_sanity.sh: line 285: buildifier: command not found

So, I can't iterate locally to address this. 

Moreover, I seem to be getting another set of messages locally that the execution of the sanity check script doesn't seem to produce for you on Jenkins:

> FAIL: mismatch in packaged licenses and external dependencies
> Please remove the licenses for the following external dependencies:
> //third_party/hadoop
> @boringssl//
> @curl//
> @jemalloc//

These don't seem to show up in your CI build.

Please let me know what I can do to make it work.
